item.title: T.J. add a quote by Marcel Proust
item.description: "The real voyage of discovery consists not in seeking new landscapes, but in having new eyes." -- Marcel Proust

item.title: T.J. add a quote by Mary Engelbreit
item.description: "Walk towards the sunshine, and the shadows will fall behind you." -- Mary Engelbreit

item.title: T.J. add a quote by Anna Quindlen
item.description: "I would be most content if my children grew up to be the kind of people who think decorating consists mostly of building enough bookshelves." -- Anna Quindlen

item.title: T.J. add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "There is no Frigate like a Book To take us Lands away, Nor any Coursers like a Page Of prancing Poetry – This Traverse may the poorest take Without oppress of Toll – How frugal is the Chariot That bears a Human soul." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: T.J. add a quote by Apple Computer Inc.
item.description: "Here's to the crazy ones. The misfits. The rebels. The troublemakers. The round pegs in the square holes. The ones who see things differently. They're not fond of rules. And they have no respect for the status quo. You can quote them, disagree with them, glorify or vilify them. About the only thing you can't do is ignore them. Because they change things. They push the human race forward. And while some may see them as the crazy ones, we see genius. Because the people who are crazy enough to think they can change the world, are the ones who do." -- Apple Computer Inc.

item.title: T.J. add a quote by Jack Kerouac
item.description: "Happiness consists in realizing it is all a great strange dream" -- Jack Kerouac

item.title: T.J. add a quote by Yogi Berra
item.description: "The future ain't what it used to be." -- Yogi Berra

item.title: T.J. add a quote by Bob Dylan
item.description: "I'll let you be in my dreams if I can be in yours" -- Bob Dylan

item.title: T.J. add a quote by Bob Dylan
item.description: "I accept chaos, I'm not sure whether it accepts me." -- Bob Dylan

item.title: T.J. add a quote by Bob Dylan
item.description: "Don't criticize what you can't understand." -- Bob Dylan

item.title: T.J. add a quote by Bob Dylan
item.description: "Sometimes it's not enough to know what things mean, sometimes you have to know what things don't mean." -- Bob Dylan

item.title: T.J. add a quote by Bob Dylan
item.description: "All I can be is me- whoever that is. " -- Bob Dylan

item.title: T.J. add a quote by Bob Dylan
item.description: "The sun's not yellow, its chicken!" -- Bob Dylan

item.title: T.J. add a quote by Steve Almond
item.description: "But something occurred to me as I sped through that dirty shroud of fog, something Vonnegut has been trying to explain to the rest of us for most of his life. And that is this: Despair is a form of hope. It is an acknowledgment of the distance between ourselves and our appointed happiness. At certain moments, it is reason enough to live." -- Steve Almond
